reviewText: I have always enjoyed Will Ferrell's Bush impersonation and had seen bits of this on youtube so decided to purchase this. I still found it funny, but the profanity did take away from it.
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush

reviewText: This had all of the craziness Will Ferrell could muster, but the material was a little weak. There are so many ways he could have chosen to go. Unfortunately, he left a lot of good material on the table.
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush

reviewText: I don't think there is any middle ground on "Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America. A Final Night with George W. Bush."  If you are Republican or were a Bush supporter, you will probably hate this show, perhaps even finding it offensive as Ferrell does not hold back in the least. If you are like me instead, wherein you hated W from day #1 of his presidency and thought every act he did as President was unexplainable lunacy, then you will love it.  The highlight for me is the part which is potentially the most offensive, a sexual come on and bump and grind between W and Condeleza Rice. Ferrell has been honing his W act to perfection for years and by now he has every nuance of W's movements and voice down.  He looks like him, sounds like him, and pretty much is him "en flagrante" for an entire HBO special. This recreates Ferrell's Broadway show on W which was a huge success.  For those of us who never had a chance to get to Broadway for it, HBO brings it to us.
summary: If You Hated W, and I Did, You Will Love This Show
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush

reviewText: Will Ferrell stole my heart with his W impression on SNL.  Funny, biting, and ridiculous as the man himself, it was comedic perfection then, and it still is now.I was not looking for an overhaul of the past 8 years, I did not want to be stuck going through all the mistakes this one man made, whether humorous or not.  I did not want an over politicized evening of hatred with a thin guise of humor.  And I am glad because "You're Welcome, America" is none of that.  With completely false anecdotes, actual hilarious quotes, and some of the most traumatizing images I have ever seen on a TV screen, it was nothing I was expecting, but a complete success.  If you have seen Funny or Die, you know how far he can go.Although I can agree with some that there definitely some "safe" parts to his performance, I was happy to see Ferrell reign it in at times (like discussing 9/11 or when discussing the lost soldiers of this current war).  It was nice to see the full range of insanity and respect in one show.Happily, the over-the-top shenanigans do not end after this program.  The special features are good as well.  W interviews himself (which did seem to run a little long for my taste) and there is a true/false trivia game to play.  All in all, a night well spent with Will Ferrell as George W. Bush: recommended.
summary: I laughed, I cried, I gagged!
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush

reviewText: One of his best moments. Don't think it got enough publicity...whether you love or hate George W. Bush this is freaking hilarious.
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush

reviewText: Will did a great job delivering this show with little interruption necessary to prepare between segments.  His George Bush character is good but not the best, somewhat limited by his own physical appearance.  Parts of the show were very funny, but parts denigrated Bush and members of his cabinet with extraneous dirt that never took place for the sake of creating personally debasing humor that was undeserved.  I tried to judge his humor as an independent I am and not wed to party politics and ideologies.  From my perspective, I found much of the show to be way off base and lacking in humor or irony.  Those who hate Bush will probably love this routine, those who thought highly of Bush will not.  Those who appreciate humor and irony will most likely be disappointed.  I would have rated it with 2 stars but Ferrell's delivery elevated it a notch from its base themes.  It's too bad that this show did not take on the benefit of time where Bush could have blamed Obama for the future, even though he has withheld criticism since he left office.  Bush made mistakes but he never blamed Clinton for his mistakes.  Think about the difference in character between Bush and Obama.  Only those who would vilify Bush to exaggeration would use such to elevate Obama in comparison.  It is a shame that we have been reduced to taking sides based upon President's imperfections instead without taking into account the disparity in the difficulty of events during which they had to govern and how aptly they handled their power.
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush

reviewText: It's amazing that so few people seem to know about this show! This is uproarious, classic Will Ferrell at his finest. If you ever enjoyed Will Ferrell's impressions of George W. on Saturday Night Live, you must do yourself the favor of watching this bizarre Broadway production. It's one of the funniest things I've ever seen, and the passion with which Ferrell approaches this show is incredible. After embracing the character of George W., he goes on to describe his childhood, and goes all the way through his college years, adulthood, and years as president. He covers a variety of issues, such as the Iraq War and Hurricane Katrina (and his supposed infatuation with Condaleeza Rice- that part seems to be an embellishment). What's really impressive is that they manage to make this stage production pretty dynamic, with lots of visual aids, wardrobe changes, and the occasional guest. For fans of Saturday Night Live and political satire, you can't go wrong!
summary: Quite possibly Will Ferrell's best performance of all time
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush

reviewText: This was a very funny stand up routine, in which Will Farrell imitates President Bush.  I recommend this to anyone who appreciates Will's humor and Pres. Bush.
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush

reviewText: I didn't know Will Ferrell was such a good mimic, but his take on George W. Bush in YOU'RE WELCOME, AMERICA: A FINAL NIGHT WITH GEORGE W. BUSH is better than any I've seen.  YOU'RE WELCOME, AMERICA, Ferrell's 2009 one-man Cort Theatre, New York City, show, is preserved here on D.V.D..If YOU'RE WELCOME, AMERICA, has a fault, it's what you're expecting from Will Ferrell, one of the funniest people in the world, lampooning the single most-deserving object of ridicule, George W. Bush, is too much for a show running just 90 minutes.  To do justice to Bush's legacy of injustice, the Cort Theatre would have to make YOU'RE WELCOME, AMERICA into a festival, adding three more stages and having Eddie Murphy, Dana Carvey, and Frank Caliendo impersonate Bush while Ferrell works the fourth stage.But on its own terms, YOU'RE WELCOME, AMERICA is very funny.  Also, besides his George W. Bush impression being dead-on, in the final words of the show Will Ferrell gets to the heart of the second-rate second choice of everyone from his father to the voting public, this Fredo Corleone-turned-United States president.As badly as you did not want the Supreme Court to install George W. Bush in the White House, you will want to see YOU'RE WELCOME, AMERICA.
summary: Even the Supreme Court can't stop Will Ferrell
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush

reviewText: Will Ferrell's send up on W is well done in many ways, but 7 years after he left office it seems pretty dated, old hat. Some of the material seems forced and a few segments drag longer than would have been optimal. Still pretty good stuff.
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush

reviewText: With the WarHawks banging the gotta go back-in drum, it is a good time for a retrospective to see what got us into this mess in the first place.  Dubbya was getting some forgiveness air time and it is time to look back and remember the crap he laid out that cost us trillions in unfunded debt.  Besides, it's funny as all get out!!
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush

reviewText: This is a wonderful movie (quality and all) that has a serious but funny message attached, and you will leave with a very good understanding to what has happened to our America as we know it.
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush

reviewText: Will Ferrell is a funny guy and he has the voice and mannerisms of ""W"" down pat.  However, I did not appreciate the foul language, inuendos and an actual picture of a man's penis - all of this is not necessary to be funny.Guess I'm of a different generation - I would not think any of this as funny if I'd been in the audience either.Will Ferrell can do better than this.
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush

reviewText: Ferrell does an excellent job imitating former President Bush, and doesn't pull any punches doing it. On the other hand, he doesn't beat various issues into the ground. A nice, entertaining summary of 8 not so entertaining years.
summary: Brings Back Memories - This Time It's Funny!
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush

reviewText: I have to be honest when I first watched it on HBO I was, "Meh."  I don't know what was wrong with me or what I was expecting because the next time I saw it I was ROTFL! (No, I wasn't drunk.)  The same thing for the 3rd, 4th and 5th, etc...This performance gets better each time you see it I think.  You catch all the goofy, sly nuances that way.  I can't wait to own the DVD because I know it's going to make me laugh yet again.  Will, when I heard you were going to be on Broadway with a show about George Bush I though you were nuts.  I'm happy to say you proved me wrong and I will not question you ever again.
summary: Needs to be seen more than once.
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush

reviewText: Depending on your tolerance for pain, mind numbing arrogance and stupidity, you might not want to see another minute of George Bush, but with Will Ferrell starring in this final hour as Bushy, you might change your mind.With all the pain and suffering we endured during Bush's 8 years, we deserve saying good bye with a smile. Enjoy!
summary: "Ask not what your country can do for you, but what have I done to your country!"
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush

reviewText: I've watched this on HBO, and it is HILARIOUS! I'm not the biggest fan of Will Ferrell, but this is definitely the best thing I've seen him in. His impersonation of George "Dubya" Bush is dead on, and when the camera catches him from certain angles, the physical resemblance is terrifying. There are a few slow moments in the show, but most of the performance made me literally LOL. Highlights include a sexy robot dance (does such a thing exist?) between Bush and Condoleezza Rice, a slide show featuring many prominent members of the Bush Administration (Dubya remembers most of them, but not all), and a hilarious bit at the end that features Ferrell doing some improv with the audience. This is definitely worth watching if you're in the mood for a few laughs.
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush

reviewText: Funny man, best part was ad lib nicknames.Part of the show was just reading the headlines from Bush presidency.Condition was over the hop but funny.
summary: Iraq situation makes this show relevant
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush

reviewText: I laughed my butt off.  Liked the fact they through in random facts and how they showed you when they were facts.  Anything I see with Will Ferrell in it now I still seem him as President Bush.
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush

reviewText: although it started out strong at the end it was uneven. The parody was neither as virulent as I expected nor was it as funny as I had hoped. Will Farrell is a great talent but I liked him better in" Elf"
Title: Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America - A Final Night with George W. Bush
